column1: Heart disease is a major cause of health problems worldwide. There are many different types of heart disease
column2: but one that is fairly common and can have lots of negative side effects is called cardiomyopathy. We know that humans and many mammals
column4: get cardiomyopathy. In dilated cardiomyopathy the heart changes shape and often the electrical signals within the heart change. Because of these changes
column5: the heart is not able to pump blood around the body very well
column6: which means that oxygen and nutrients are not delivered to the body at the optimal levels. This can affect day-to-day life
column7: and it can also cause early death. Understanding cardiomyopathy and finding the mutations in genes that cause it are essential
column8: as this information can help us to diagnose
column10: and prevent this heart disorder. We can try to mend the broken hearts that do not work properly. In dogs with cardiomyopathy
column11: we have discovered genetic mutations and found links between these changes in the dogs' hearts.
